before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5o53r","text":"Prepare sterilized and 0.2 micron filtered seawater (FSW).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ll3a","text":"Collect healthy coral fragments","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p8q4","text":"Collect diseased coral fragments","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vpa7","text":"Randomly assign tanks to treatments ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eev7a","text":"Label and UV Ziploc bags and Falcon tubes and other material taht cannot be autoclaved ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a40nu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"442pb","text":"This protocol is to study disease in Acropora cervicornis by using a disease homogenate method. These methods are adapted from methods presented in Muller 2018 https://elifesciences.org/articles/35066.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":40}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2E267B09102F11EB9C180A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://elifesciences.org/articles/35066"}}}}

materials.name: Filtered and autoclaved seawater (FSW; artificial seawater also works)
10% bleach (1:10 dilution of commercial 5.25-6.0% hypochlorite bleach)

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"1cdnc","text":"Erinn M Muller, Erich Bartels, Iliana B Baums (2018) Bleaching causes loss of disease resistance within the threatened coral species Acropora cervicornis eLife 7:e35066. doi: 10.7554/eLife.35066","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: 10% bleach (1:10 dilution of commercial 5.25-6.0% hypochlorite bleach)
Filtered and autoclaved seawater (FSW; artificial seawater also works)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1vfu1","text":"Clean -up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flp4c","text":"Bleach tweezers, clippers, slates, airgun, surfaces","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b24bt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24kfl","text":"Dose experimental corals with the placebo and disease homogenates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qecf","text":"Obtain healthy and diseased Acropora cervicornis fragments. These fragments are preferably collected from the same area and with similar disease progression.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":28,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajsnk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bc9vj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pvvb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6vlf1","text":"The tissue areas should be similar between healthy and disease corals to prepare diseased and placebo blastates with similar concentrations.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"B57F3C50101E11EBAE9373BCAE9950A2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9uvf","text":"Prepare placebo and disease homogenates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33q96","text":"Grab healthy fragments from the holding tank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46l9u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c3mej","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bjrp2","text":"Sigle branch fragments are easier to blast and to estimate their tissue area. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8cmo7","text":"If cutting different branches, use clean clippers.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6upat","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"0A8E1160102111EBAE9373BCAE9950A2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ub44","text":"Grab a fragment and hold it over a pre-labeled Ziploc bag (** this will require two people**). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41a36","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dm4l","text":"Airbrush the tissue with an airgun and FSW.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs5fb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kc9l","text":"Approximately    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"685a0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8s7th","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7pkc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0406","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0pqv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"27FE2FA0102B11EBAE9373BCAE9950A2","id":0,"label":"per fragment","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"smart_component","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"fields":[{"guid":"DCBBDEB0102B11EBAE9373BCAE9950A2","name":"Number of fragments to blast","required":false,"type_id":0,"value":""}],"guid":"E59EA670102B11EBAE9373BCAE9950A2","is_in_editor":true}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53rda","text":"Work in a fume hood if possible to avoid blasting aerosols.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3qana","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b0kp1","text":"When working with disease fragments, remove the tissue up to 5 cm above the lesion.  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"52D538D0102211EBAE9373BCAE9950A2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hg9d","text":" Take a picture of every fragment with a size scale to estimate the amount of tissue blasted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3d8b1","text":"Pour homogenate in a pre-labeled 50mL falcon tube(s). Measure volume and store in the fridge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1v50l","text":"Grab diseased fragments from the holding tank. And repeat steps 2.2 - 2.5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9q0l1","text":"Bring placebo and diseased homogenates to the same volume by adding FSW","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93h1p","text":"Add 20 beads to each falcon tube containing ~ 40mL of homogenate and vortex for 10 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hf8t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vf6f","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8pkdp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"3707DE00102C11EBAE9373BCAE9950A2","id":0,"label":"each tube","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26sip","text":"Sterile razor with bleach and scratch a small area of each experimental coral","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0srb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6rldr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dum7l","text":"Create a ring around the coral located ~ 1cm from the bottom","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"03A01B20102911EBAE9373BCAE9950A2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4jf4l","text":"Apply 500 uL of placebo and disease homogenate above each coral fragments in their respective treatments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1lme2","text":"Save and preserve ~ 500 ul of both homogenates for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb8ht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3qrj4","text":"Change gloves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"drqs3","text":"Add 16 L of seawater to each tank to completely cover the fragments ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ddi4","text":"Discard bags and falcon tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2rf65","text":"Rinse fragments with FSW, and place them in a sterile container with enough FSW to cover them. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"85kv2","text":"Maintained closed system for 3hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Homogenate of A. cervicornis
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"7g5lh","text":"Wear gloves and masks when dealing with pathogens especially those of unknown origin.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
